intro: Cyanea grimesiana subsp. obatae, commonly known as the Kauai bluebell, is a rare flowering plant native to Hawaii. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and is adapted to the unique ecological conditions of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
